text: Major Rawls and Sgt. Landsman arrive at the scene of the shooting; Detective Bunk Moreland recovers Greggs' weapon and finds evidence (footprints, clothing) left by the shooters.
Rawls finds McNulty visibly shaken and in a state of shock at the crime scene following Greggs' shooting.
Detective Freamon refocuses the distraught Barksdale detail, urging them back to monitoring the wiretap to capture any incriminating discussion about the shooting.
Detective Carver notifies Greggs' family and her partner, Cheryl, about the critical shooting incident.
At the hospital, Major Rawls unusually offers comfort to McNulty, insisting Greggs' shooting is not McNulty's fault.
Dep. Comm. Burrell misunderstands Cheryl's relationship with Greggs at the hospital; Commissioner Frazier avoids speaking with Cheryl, leaving Burrell to handle it awkwardly.
Returning home alone from the hospital, Cheryl breaks down emotionally over Greggs' critical condition.
Mistakenly believing low-level dealer Little Man shot Greggs, Stringer Bell orders Wee-Bey Brice to murder him.
In the Pit, D'Angelo, Poot, and Bodie initially discuss the shooting, incorrectly assuming it was unrelated street violence.
During surveillance, Herc and Santangelo observe Bodie receiving a drug resupply dropped from a specific window in the towers; Herc notes the window number.
Wallace calls Poot from the Eastern Shore, expressing homesickness but little else.
Bodie sees Savino's picture on the news as wanted and notices Little Man's disappearance, leading the Pit crew to realize the shooting was connected to their operation.
Bodie theorizes someone within the organization made a mistake related to the shooting, anticipating Avon will order retaliatory killings.
Stringer orders D'Angelo to accompany Wee-Bey on an unspecified task; D'Angelo fears he is being taken away to be killed for perceived disloyalty or mistakes.
D'Angelo's assignment is revealed: he is merely tasked with driving Wee-Bey to Philadelphia, presumably so Wee-Bey can hide out after the shooting.
Wallace calls Poot again from the Eastern Shore, this time asking for money to return to Baltimore.
Freamon and Prez link a pager message sent to Stringer Bell shortly after the shooting to a specific payphone near the crime scene.
Freamon directs crime scene technicians to collect fingerprints from the identified payphone and a nearby discarded drink can.
McNulty arrives at the detail office drunk, leading to a confrontation with Lt. Daniels about his behavior and focus.
In Homicide, Bunk and Landsman discuss the shooting, considering theories of a robbery gone wrong or a deliberate setup by the Barksdales.
Freamon confirms the fingerprints recovered from the payphone area match those of Barksdale dealer Little Man.
Unaware of the shooting, Bubbles tries to page Greggs for help and is subsequently arrested by patrol officers.
A confused Bubbles is aggressively interrogated by Detective Holley, who begins to beat him before Landsman intervenes.
McNulty retrieves Bubbles but, misinterpreting his state and ignoring his attempts to say he's clean, gives him money intended for drugs.
Bubbles deduces that Wee-Bey and Little Man were likely involved in Greggs' shooting and relays this vital information to McNulty (who passes it to Bunk).
Distraught and unheard by McNulty, Bubbles is left holding the drug money, jeopardizing his recent sobriety.
McNulty improperly threatens Barksdale lawyer Maurice Levy, warning of financial investigations if Levy doesn't produce his client Savino.
ASA Pearlman reprimands McNulty for threatening the influential Levy, accusing McNulty of ruthlessly using anyone to achieve his goals.
Levy produces Savino, who claims he only intended to sell Orlando fake drugs (baking soda) and denies any involvement in the subsequent shooting.
Seeking positive press after the officer shooting, Dep. Comm. Burrell orders Rawls, Foerster, and Daniels to organize immediate, widespread drug raids across the city.

Daniels instructs his detail to offer up the Barksdale cutting house identified by Herc for the raids, but to strategically withhold the location of the main stash house (found by Freamon) to protect the wiretap case.
Major Bobby Reed confronts Daniels, revealing knowledge of withheld targets, thus confirming to Daniels that there is an active mole within his detail.
McNulty attempts to enlist Judge Phelan's help against Burrell's premature raids but fails, as Phelan has secured his place back on the mayor's ticket and is avoiding controversy.
Large-scale drug raids are executed targeting the Barksdale cutting house, Savino's residence, and the Franklin Terrace towers.
During a raid, Herc and Carver discover a large amount of cash and once again contemplate stealing some.
The citywide raids result in significant seizures of drugs, guns, and money, providing Commissioner Frazier with a desired public relations victory.
In the aftermath of the raids and Greggs' shooting, investigative work in the Barksdale detail office largely ceases; Prez monitors minimal phone activity.
Amid the detail's effective shutdown and focus on the raids, Wallace's potentially crucial phone call to Poot asking to return home goes unnoticed on the wiretap.
Detective Kima Greggs remains hospitalized on life support, her condition critical.
